tpwm.title: Key Bindings for Zigli's Editor
tpwm.body:
Function Keys
KeyCommand F1Save F2Complete Word F3Save File As F4Compile F5Undo F6Redo F7Refresh Buffer F8Clear Buffer F9Open File F10Menu Bar (ESC to return to buffer) F11Remote Save (FTP upload of a Remote Edit downloaded file) F12Remote Edit (download from a ZServer)
KeyCommand Ctrl-F2Toggle Line Numbers Ctrl-F8 Add Picture Ctrl-F10UnPack64 Ctrl-Shift-F10Pack64 Ctrl-F11Upload File (FTP) Ctrl-F12FTP Get File
KeyCommand Shift-F1Save as a Styled File Shift-F5Record KeyStroke Macro Shift-F6End Recording Macro Shift-F7Execute Macro
Letter Keys NOTE: The alt key is used with the Alphabet modes to implement the corresponding Keymaps. See the Alphabet Menu for the available alphabets. Alt combines with Shift and Ctrl for various related symbols as well depending on the Keymap. Here, a Keymap is any mapping of keys to Unicode characters associated to a named Alphabet mode, registered in the Alphabets.data file.
SPACEBAR: Alt-SPACEBAR is like a Shift-right_mouse click on a word or highlighted text, bringing up the Dictionary/Thesaurus menu for that word or phrase. Alt-Shift-SPACEBAR is like Alt-Shift-right_mouse on a word or highlighted text, bringing up a Dictionary dialog box for entering dictionary entries for that word or phrase.
BACKSPACE: Alt-BACKSPACE deletes previous word.
KeyCommand Ctrl-ASelect All Ctrl-Shift-AAdd New e-mail address Ctrl-BAdd New Quickwords Ctrl-CCopy Ctrl-Shift-CDelete Quickwords Ctrl-Alt-CSet Font Color Ctrl-DRemove e-mail address Ctrl-EReload Quickwords (after editing) Ctrl-FToggle Clickpad Ctrl-GSTART (sets up new file in a given editing mode) Ctrl-HBackspace Ctrl-IToggle italic font style (of highlighted text or buffer) Ctrl-Alt-IMinimize all windows Ctrl-JToggle bold font style (of highlighted text or buffer) Ctrl-K Toggle TeX colors Ctrl-LMove current line to the middle of the buffer window Ctrl-Shift-L Lower Case (word) Ctrl-MQuickMail (for sending e-mail) Ctrl-Shift-MGet Mail Ctrl-Alt-MMaximize all windows Ctrl-NNew Buffer Window Crtl-Alt-NNext Buffer Ctrl-O Toggles Trace on/off Ctrl-P Print Buffer Ctrl-Shift-PToggles character/paragraph assignment of text style attributes Ctrl-Q Quit (closes window) Ctrl-RContinue Search or Search-and-Replace Ctrl-Shift-RStart Search-and-Replace Ctrl-SStart Search Ctrl-TAnnotate text Ctrl-Alt-TTile windows (leaves minimized as they are) Ctrl-UGet generic web browser Ctrl-Shift-U Upper Case (word) Ctrl-VPaste Ctrl-WClose Shell Window Ctrl-XCut Ctrl-YAnnotate text as a hyperlink Ctrl-ZMove current line to top of buffer window Ctrl-Shift-ZShell Command Line Ctrl-Alt-ZOne Window (maximize current window, minimize the others)
